SMTP mailer not active (or to be activated)
entry.summary: Hi, Changing from hosted to docker version of TT-RSS (yes, Iâ€™m late to the party but it worked great all the time). I want to activate SMTP mailer but a little confused about the right steps. tt-rss/ttrss-mailer-smtp: SMTP mailer plugin for tt-rss based on PHPMailer - ttrss-mailer-smtp - Tiny Tiny RSS Updated tt-rss install to version v22.12-c30b24d09 plugin on var/www/html/tt-rss/plugins.local/mailer_smtp verified added TTRSS_PLUGINS=mailer_smtp to .env Added the SMTP data to the .env file for my docker-compose installation. But on the preferences\plug-ins page I have a grey tick for the mailer_smtp plugin and a green one for nginx_xaccel and auth_internal (but I have not defined that in .env) When I try to send a testmail the following error is triggerd by classes/mailer.php:59 classes/mailer.php(59): user_error(Error sending mail: Unknown error while sending mail. Hooks tried: 0.) classes/mailer.php(51): set_error(Unknown error while sending mail. Hooks tried: 0.) classes/pref/system.php(25): mail([{â€œto_name":â€œâ€,â€œto_addressâ€:"test@domain.comâ€,â€œsubjectâ€:â€œTest message from tt-rssâ€,â€œmessageâ€:â€œThis message confirms that tt-rss can send outgoing mail.â€}) backend.php(136): sendTestEmail() Real IP: 77.xxx.xxx.xxx Tried with some variants on line number 3. the TTRSS_PLUGINS line but that gave errors or blank pages. Looks like Iâ€™m missing the last bit of the puzzle.

entry.title: Unable to use fetch() on TT-RSS API
entry.summary:
Hello, I have a problem when I want to access API using fetch() with vue.js. created() function of my component I make a call to the api in this way: fetch('https://rss.mydomain.ch/tt-rss/api/', { method: "POST", headers: { "Accept": "application/json", "Content-Type": "application/json", }, body: JSON.stringify({ "sid": "API_KEY", "op": "getHeadlines", "feed_id": -3, "order_by": "date_reverse" }) }) .then(response => response.json()) .then(data => console.log(data))
And I still get a CORS related error: Access to fetch at â€˜https://rss.mydomain.ch/tt-rss/api/â€™ from origin â€˜http://localhost:8080â€™ has been blocked by CORS policy: Response to preflight request doesnâ€™t pass access control check: No â€˜Access-Control-Allow-Originâ€™ header is present on the requested resource. If an opaque response serves your needs, set the requestâ€™s mode to â€˜no-corsâ€™ to fetch the resource with CORS disabled. I understand that I need to set up the â€œAccess-Control-Allow-Originâ€ header, but how do I do it on the tt-rss API? TT-RSS runs with docker behind an nginx reverse proxy. I followed the installation as explained here. When I use Insomnia/Postman, no problem appears. I have already tried several things: add mode: no-cors in the query some solutions proposed in the topics of this forum, but the problem still persists.

entry.title: Error when editing multiple feeds (disabling e-mail digest)
entry.summary: Thanks! Can confirm that issues is fixed and digest can be disabled in batch.

entry.title: Get Gitlab feeds working?
entry.summary: GitLab is sending invalid XHTML, which LibXML (used by tt-rss) doesnâ€™t like. At minimum, img tags arenâ€™t being closed properly in summary content. There are probably no feed items with img tags when you see successful parsing. Options including contacting GitLab to get that fixed, or creating a tt-rss plugin to fix up the content (likely by using the HOOK_FEED_FETCHED hook).

entry.title: Get Gitlab feeds working?
entry.summary: [x] Iâ€™m not using docker on my primary instance, but my issue can be reproduced on the aforementioned docker setup and/or official demo. Apparently, except for the fact that Gitlab " is overbloated shit garbage", its Atom feeds seem to be malformed as as well. Since there is no other topic here discussing this problem, Iâ€™m curious about whether this is specific to the example feed below (unlikely) and/or whether thereâ€™s a way to remedy this. Hereâ€™s the output by myfeedsucks for https://gitlab.com/librewolf-community/browser/windows.atom: It should be noted that once every month or so, problematic posts that create these issues with the feed are absent and tt-rss does successfully parse the feed. Fetch error: N/A Error: LibXML error 76 at line 157 (column 656): Opening and ending tag mismatâ€¦

entry.title: Error when editing multiple feeds (disabling e-mail digest)
entry.summary: welp. actually not yet fixed. i forgot about this stupid PDO behavior which casts everything to string by default so booleans with false values become an empty string breaking everything. e: deal with type errors in batch feed editor properly, un-deprecate PDO wrapper functions and document them for posterity Â· c30b24d09f - tt-rss - Tiny Tiny RSS

entry.title: Error when editing multiple feeds (disabling e-mail digest)
entry.summary: fix: batch feed editor: Â· a16acd65fc - tt-rss - Tiny Tiny RSS

entry.title: Error when editing multiple feeds (disabling e-mail digest)
entry.summary:
thanks for reporting, actual problem after brief investigation: "Uncaught PDOException: SQLSTATE[42804]: Datatype mismatch: 7 ERROR: column "always_display_enclosures" is of type boolean but expression is of type integer
the whole undefined thing is cosmetic although it should also be fixed.

entry.title: Error when editing multiple feeds (disabling e-mail digest)
entry.summary:
[x] Iâ€™m using stock docker compose setup, unmodified. Tiny Tiny RSS version (latest v22.12-2be8d58): Platform docker-compose docker-compose running on VPS with 8GB RAM When I edit multiple feeds to disable e-mail digest nothing happens and error is logged in browser console and docker app Steps to reproduce the problem: Select multiple feeds in feed list ( /tt-rss/prefs.php ) Click Feeds / Edit selected feeds Disable email digest by checking check mark
Click save 4.) Saving data will appear and nothing happens
Error in browser console when saving:
Error log in app container: ttrss-docker-app-1 | [30-Dec-2022 15:01:51 UTC] PHP Fatal error: Uncaught PDOException: SQLSTATE[42804]: Datatype mismatch: 7 ERROR: column "include_in_digest" is of type boolean but expression is of type intâ€¦

entry.title: Is it possible to subscribe to a local-to-tt-rss file?
entry.summary: Iâ€¦ have concerns about the consequences of this post, but yes. If your feed is accessible via a domain, i.e. http://mydomain/feed.rss then yes, itâ€™s absolutely possible. Iâ€™ve done it for years, although I had to stop using localhost when the change fox mentioned went into effect. I run tt-rss on an internal-only machine, and have for years, and it has worked perfectly fine, other than that one hiccup for security reasons. If you want to do file:// or anything like that, then no. The finer points of making a local file accessible via your web server while being secure from anyone-who-is-not-you may be outside of the scope of this forum, though.

entry.summary: i find it amusing that its always arch kids who are so helpless at first sign of any basic troubleshooting.

entry.title: Help with installation process
entry.summary:
nuteko: Then I opened the browser and typed http://localhost:8280 Try going to the value of TTRSS_SELF_URL_PATH in the .env file (likely http://localhost:8280/tt-rss ).
nuteko: once I typed the address the browser just couldnâ€™t connect to it. If the URL above doesnâ€™t work you need to be more specific, and should probably look into why 194.83.9.2 (presumably your public IP) is showing up in your sudo iptables -L DOCKER output-- which is not tt-rss specific.
nuteko: no worth asking about it then. not even on a official forum where the question can be anything related to this application. Your refund is in the mail.

entry.title: A Guide To Command-Line Data Manipulation
entry.summary: No more random scripts in Python and JavaScript to transform CSV or JSON data. In this article, Alvin Bryan shows you how to use Miller, a small and powerful CLI tool, to do all your data processing.

entry.title: Filter on mp4 media:content attachments
entry.summary:
Hi all! I have one feed where posts occasionally have links to MP4 files as media:content attached. The code in the RSS XML looks like this: <media:content url="https://files.mastodon.social/cache/media_attachments/files/109/584/612/582/360/330/original/5756bf06913dd6fa.mp4" type="video/mp4" fileSize="6684418" medium="video"> <media:rating scheme="urn:simple">adult</media:rating> </media:content>
I am trying to filter on these posts and tried the filter regex â€œ.mp4â€ in â€œContentâ€ and in â€œLinkâ€ but neither did match these posts. Is there a way to trigger on such attachments? Reiner

entry.title: Deploying CSS Logical Properties On Web Apps
entry.summary: You may have already heard of CSS logical properties or RTL adaptations but are still deciding whether to deploy them widely. To help raise your awareness of their possibilities, Nicolas Hoffmann shares his experience of how he and his team at Proton carried out a massive move from CSS logical props to production and how you can consider them from a different perspective in your very own projects.

Filtering [https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/programming-guide/concepts/linq/filtering-data] refers to the process of restricting the result set to contain only those elements that satisfy a specified condition. entry.title: Help choose the syntax for CSS Nesting
entry.summary: CSS Nesting is making the rounds yet again. Remember earlier this year when Adam and Miriam put three syntax options up for a vote? Those results were tallied and it wasnâ€™t even even close. Now thereâ€™s another chance â€¦ Help choose the syntax for CSS Nesting originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.

entry.title: WordPress Playground: Running WordPress in the Browser
entry.summary: Being able to quickly spin up a WordPress instance has been the strength of WordPress ever since its famous â€œfive-minute installâ€. Upload a few files, configure a few settings, and youâ€™re off. entry.title: Understanding Privacy: Protect Your Users, Protect Yourself
entry.summary: All of us want to create inclusive, safe, and privacy-aware digital experiences, but where to begin? Our brand new Smashing Book, â€œUnderstanding Privacy,â€ written by Heather Burns, can help you lay the ground for future developers, designers, and project managers to build a better web for tomorrow. [Jump to the details](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/12/understanding-privacy-new-smashing-book/#about-the-book) or [get the book right away](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/printed-books/understanding-privacy/).

entry.title: 3D printing in Automotive: How Å koda Auto made it
entry.summary: Å koda Auto is an important member of the Volkswagen Group and the biggest employer in Czechia. Å koda manufactured more than 800 000 cars in 2021 for customers all around the world. The company is not only a symbol of the Czech... The post 3D printing in Automotive: How Å koda Auto made it appeared first on Original Prusa 3D Printers.
